mexican.text: I never ask God to give me anything; I only ask him to put me where things are.
A bird in hand is worth more than a hundred in flight.
A golden cage is still a cage.
A good cock will crow on every dungheap.
A good man finds his native soil in every country.
A good resolution is like an old horse, which is often saddled but rarely ridden.
A jealous lover becomes an indifferent spouse.
A lamp in the street, obscurity at home.
A man forewarned is equal to two.
A man without happiness is either not good or not well.
A person born to be a flower pot will not go beyond the porch.
As to tastes, nothing is written.
As you see yourself, I once saw myself; as you see me now, you will be seen.
Avarice commonly occasions injury to the person who displays it.
Better a donkey that tarries than one that won't carry its load.
Better a steady drip than a sudden deluge.
Better a stride that will last than a trot that tires fast.
Better alone unattached than unsuitably matched.
Better one timely squawk than constant talk.
Better to be alone than in bad company.
Better to be red-faced once than times purple.
A secret between two is god's secret; a secret between three is known to all.
A word and a stone once thrown away cannot be returned.
Agreements should be clearly expressed, and chocolate should be served thick.
All time spent angry is time lost being happy.
Although a monkey be dressed in silk, she is still a monkey.
Ambition never has it's fill.
An answer without a question signals guilt without question.
An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox.
An empty bag will not stay up.
An idle mind is the devil's playground.
God helps the early riser.
God is bigger than your problems.
God speaks for the man who holds his peace.
Great deeds are reserved for great men.
He is not fat -- it is his belt that doesn't fit.
He is not to blame who does his duty.
He loses his thanks who promises and delays.
He who asks a question does not err easily.
He who assists everybody assists nobody.
He who covers you discovers you.
It's not the fault of the indian, but of he who makes of the indian his friend.
It's not the fault of the mouse, but of the one who offers him the cheese.
Jealous about honor and careless about providing.
Keep your counsel arrested until it's requested.
Let him attack who will; the strong wait.
Let not the tongue speak what the head may have to pay for.
Let the water you cannot drink flow by.
Let water run that you do not intend to drink.
Lions believe that everyone shares their state of mind.
Look at the man you serve and you will see how much you are esteemed.
Don't break down, rope; this is the last jerk.
Don't cut your cactus in a neighbor's garden.
Don't do good that could look bad.
Don't do today what you can put off until tomorrow.
Duty before devotion.
Early bird catches the worm.
Envious persons never compliment, they only swallow.
Even the best horse needs to be spurred.
Even the saints' patience has its limits.
Even waking up early doesn't hurry the dawn.
He who lives with hope dies happy.
He who loiters hears ill spoken of himself.
He who makes more of you than usual either designs to cheat you or wants your assistance.
He who never goes to your house doesn't want you in his.
He who punishes one chastises a hundred.
He who really wants to die will not complain if he is buried standing up.
He who speaks too much is tiresome; he who speaks too little is boring.
He who spits in the air will have it fall back on his face.
He who strikes first, strikes twice.
He who suffers many evils is comforted with just a little good.
He who talks too much errs much.
He who walks with wolves learns to howl.
He who wants everything will lose everything.
He whoa breeds crows, will have his eyes taken out- you harvest what you planted.
Hell must be in bad condition when even the devil stays out.
Hope dies last of all.
How beautiful to watch the rain and not get wet.
Hunger brings people down, but pride can help them get up.
If it does not stink, it is not a foot.
Everyone has their own way of killing fleas.
Everyone is as god made him and very often worse.
Everyone is master of their own fear.
Everyone is the son of his own works.
Everyone knows where his own shoe pinches him.
Everyone makes firewood of a fallen tree.
Everyone stones the tree that bears fruit.
Everything wears away from use.
Evil falls on him who goes to seek it.
Eyes that don't see have less to lament.
The tongue slow and the eyes quick.
The whole arena tells them to kill the bull, yet the bull should kill no one.
There is more time than life.
There is no choosing between two things of no value.
There is no evil that comes without something good.
There's no better mirror than an old friend.
There's no better sauce than a good appetite.
There's no life so tiring as one of doing nothing.
There's no reason to walk on the branches when the trunk is so thick.
There's no worse deaf man than the man who doesn't want to listen.
The ill-mannered child finds a father wherever he goes.
The insane are told they're right.
The lap of its owner is security enough for a cat.
The lazy is a brother of the begger.
The lazy work twice as much.
The lion believes that everyone shares his state of mind.
The lover of a student does not always become the wife of a graduate.
The more one looks, the less one sees.
The most desirable woman is always the one who belongs to someone else.
The mule wasn't born wild, the stick made her that way.
False hope kills more readily than bitter truth.
Fear doesn't travel by donkey.
For every dog there is an appropriate stick.
For whoever wants the blue sky, the price is high.
Foreign bread is good for your son.
Fortune favors the brave.
Fortune is like a wall that falls on those who lean on it.
From the fallen tree everyone makes firewood.
God did not give wings to scorpions.
God does not hear you if you do not speak.
One timely shout is better than constant talk.
Only men with thick lips should smoke a cigar.
Only the pallbearers know the weight of the dead.
Parrots are green everywhere; the idiot loses wherever he is.
Pay what you owe and you will know what you are worth.
Pray indeed, but get to work.
Respect for the rights of others is peace.
Revenge is a dish that tastes better cold.
Rocking chairs make long-tailed cats uneasy.
Self-praise amounts to self-condemnation.
Wounds from the knife are healed, but not those from the tongue.
Yes, old: But never sexually cold.
You cannot worship an unknown saint.
You don't look a gift horse in the mouth.
You judge the way you live.
You must not tell all that you know, nor judge all that you see, if you would live in peace.
Your hometown is like a small fatherland.
Youth is a folly; maturity, a struggle; old age a remorse.
Better to die on your feet than to live on your knees.
Between the beginning and the end there is always a middle.
Blood boils without flame.
By the claw you may know the lion.
Calm seas make sorry sailors.
Cleanliness is the luxury of the poor.
Conversation is food for the soul.
Do good and don't worry to whom.
Do not refuse the body what it asks for.
Don't be afraid of the chili pepper, even though it's so red.
The dog that has his bitch in town never barks well.
The eleventh commandment: Thou shalt not contradict.
The envious never give praise, they only take it in.
The fewer donkeys, the more corncobs.
The fewer the donkeys, the more ears of corn.
The frog squashed the hardest croaks the louder.
The good judge starts at home.
The heir's tears are but a mask to disguise his joy.
The house does not rest upon the ground, but upon a woman.
The hypocrite is known by his actions, not by his clothes.
When on an unenjoyable walk, walk faster.
When the river sounds, it's because it carries water.
When two paupers get married it is the beginning of a generation of beggars.
When you see that someone is cutting your neighbor's beard, start wetting yours.
When young, it's all dreams; when old, all memories.
Where one door closes, another one opens.
Where the river makes a sound, you can be sure it's carrying water.
Where there are trees there are no builders.
Where there are weapons, there will be wars.
Where there was fire, ashes remain.
Love is blind -- but not the neighbors.
Love is too rare to be lost on jealousy.
Make deaf ears to stupid words.
Malice leaves reality behind.
Man can adjust to anything except not eating.
Marriage and shroud, from heaven will come.
Marriage is the only war in which you sleep with the enemy.
Men meet, only mountains do not.
Money is a good servant, but an evil master.
Necessity is a great teacher.
He who gives what he can is no further obligated.
He who grabs much grasps little.
He who has a hundred and one pesos, and owes a hundred and two, let him commend himself to god.
He who is a parrot is green wherever he is.
He who is accustomed to evil is offended by good.
He who is anxious to secure the best tends to get stuck with the worst of the rest.
He who is ignorant at home is ignorant abroad.
He who keeps a secret prevents much mischief.
He who knows nothing neither doubts nor fears anything.
He who lingers around will hear bad things spoken about him.
If it is not stolen, it is a legacy.
If the hope is lost, it's better to hurry.
If the river sounds, it's because it has water.
If you don't honor your wife, you are dishonoring yourself.
If you give away what you have, you will not yearn for what you see.
If you see your neighbor has lost his beard, you'd best start lathering yours.
If you want to live in peace, you must not tell everything that you know, nor judge everything that you see.
If you would be a good judge, pay attention to what everyone says.
If you're going to rest under the sun, it's better to keep walking.
In the matter of pigs, all is money, and in the matter of money, all are pigs.
Nobody lives in another person's head.
Nobody wants to buy a sleeping horse.
Not all that glitters is gold.
Not so much that it burns the saint, nor so little that it doesn't illuminate him.
Of doctor and poet, musician and madman, we each have a trace.
Old debts are not paid, and new ones are left to get old.
Once the dog's dead, the rabies end.
One man driven by distress does as much as thirty.
One needn't study to become a fool.
One string is good enough to a good musician.
Necessity is mother of every invention.
Never ask God to give you anything; ask Him to put you where things are.
Never confuse gratitude with love.
No fate is worse than a life without a love.
No man's a prophet in his own land.
No one can bind himself to perform the impossible.
No one knows for whom they work.
No one trips with the same stone twice.
No road is safer than the one just robbed.
Nobody leaves this world alive.
The one who went to La Villa, lost his/her chair.
The person who asks for little deserves nothing.
The prickly pear has company only when it bears fruit.
The rat that knows but one hole is soon caught by the cat.
The rat who only knows about one hole will soon be caught by the cat.
The right time to dine is: for the rich man, when he is hungry; and for the poor, when he has something to eat.
The road to hell is strewn with roses.
The seagull thinks it is an act of kindness to give the fish a lift in the air.
The sin carries its own penance.
The throat must pay for what the tongue may say.
Shrimp that sleeps is carried by the tide.
Since excuses were invented, no one is ever in the wrong.
Sorrow also sings, when it runs to deep to cry.
Speak plain -- call bread bread, and wine wine.
Stupidity closes the doors of kindness.
Talking about bulls is not the same as facing them in the ring.
Tell me what you want to buy and I will tell you what you are.
Ten who shout obtain more than ten who remains silent.
The best bullfighter is the one in the box seats.
There's no worse struggle than one that never begins.
Those who rescue are always crucified.
Though a cage may be made of gold, it is still a cage.
Though the cage be made of gold, it's still a prison.
Time heals and then it kills.
To the dead, internment and, to the living, enjoyment orto the dead, the grave and, to the living, chicken.
To the hungry man no bread is bad.
To the satiated bird, cherries taste bitter.
To win a dispute is to gain a chicken and lose a cow.
Tree that grows crooked will never be straightened - bad habits learned early in life are hard to get rid of later.
He who divides and shares is left with the best share.
He who does not honor his wife dishonors himself.
He who does not intend to pay is not troubled in making his bargain.
He who does not praise a thing is he who buys it.
He who does not venture has no luck.
He who doesn't look ahead remains behind.
He who doesn't speak will get no help from God.
He who doesn't speak-up is never heard.
He who follows his own advice must take the consequences.
He who gets drenched at dawn has the rest of the day to dry out.
In this treacherous world there is neither truth nor lie; everything is like the color of the crystal through which you gaze.
In youth we learn, in old age we understand.
It is better to be a fool than obstinate.
It is in our work that we discover love and faith.
It is not enough to know how to ride you must also know how to fall.
It's a bad start on the week for the man who is hanged on a monday.
It's better to be poor, than to live alone.
It's easy to trust a cat once you put the cream out of reach.
It's not enough to know how to ride -- one must also know how to fall.
It's not the able that give, but the desirous.
True friendship is one soul shared by two bodies.
Trust your best friend as you would your worst enemy.
Truth suffers but never perishes.
Walk your own road and bear your own load.
We are all made of the same clay, but not from the same mold.
We were born to die anyhow.
When hunger comes through the door, love jumps out the window.
When in doubt of what is right, consult your pillow overnight.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
mexican.description: Act the way that the people around you are acting. This phrase might come in handy when you’re traveling abroad notice that people do things differently than you’re used to.

mexican.text: When it's time to fry the beans, you can't do without lard.
Where there's a will there's a way.
While life yet lasts, laughter and molasses.
While young, it's all dreams; when old, all memories.
Who wakes up early gets the God's help.
With patience and a bit of spittle, the elephant picks up the ant so little.
With poison, one drop is enough.
Words and feathers are carried away by the wind.
Words of the mouth are like a stone in a sling.
Works, and not words, are the proofs of love.
Worth makes the man and want of it the fellow.
The bowman who is a bad marksman has a lie ready.
The brave man lives until the coward wants.
The brave one lives as long as the cowards lets him.
The closed mouth doesn't catch any flies.
The clown is best in his own country, and the gentleman anywhere.
The crime accuses itself.
The dead to his burial ground, and the living to his fooling around.
The deaf does not listen, but invents well.
The devil is wiser not because he's the devil, but because he's old.
The Devil knows more because he's old than because he's the devil.
He who speaks too much is tiresome; he who speaks to little is boring.
If you want to live in peace, you mustn’t tell everything you know, or judge everything you see.
If you don’t honor your wife, you are dishonoring yourself.
The heir’s tears are but a mask to disguise his joy.
He who doesn’t speak will get no help from God.
He, who knows nothing neither doubts nor fears anything.
Speak plain — call bread bread, and wine wine.
Love is blind — but not the neighbors.
Theheir’s tears are but a mask to disguise his joy.
He started with nothing and still he has just his begging bag.
It’s not the fault of the mouse, but of the one who offers him the cheese.
The lion believes that everyone shares its state of mind.
Even the saints’ patience has its limits.
It’s not enough to know how to ride — you must also know how to fall.
A hungry man praises every dish.
He is not fat — it is his belt that doesn’t fit.
